discourse_list.title: Refocusing DAI back to a maximally reliable dollar

content.content: Hi, I wrote a thread on my view that DAI’s current strategy is inconsistent and Maker should, in my view, consider refocusing back on being a maximally reliable dollar. Look, I’ll be blunt  Maker has the best governance apparatus in the world Maker’s community & core teams know more about finance, stables, holding a peg, etc., then I’ll ever know yet, Maker’s execution excellence and my relative financial ignorance have no bearing whatsoever on the observation that Maker’s strategy has been fundamentally all over the place for a couple years, at least since Black Thursday.  I’ll add that I’ve tried to address pieces of these issues in the past, including during the early weeks after Black Thursday, and have never received substantial engagement from Maker leadership. tbh in my perception, there’s an aspect of elitism here, and its track record of it has started to speak for itself. I was a huge DAI customer, I loved DAI, DAI’s reputational asset is significant, and I hope to be able to be a big customer of DAI in the future. But rn for years, I don’t even know what DAI is doing. It doesn’t give me censorship resistance or general risk minimization, and I can’t use my house as real-world collateral to borrow against, so there’s just no fit there, and that’s too bad. Regardless of what the Maker community decides to do here, wishing you success. Best, Ryan
